narrative: The exchange opens with casual greetings, but telemetry shows elevated stress and self-criticism beneath a mostly neutral tone. You display strong support-seeking and decisiveness, with some avoidance when shifting into the XAI hackathon/career topic. Overall, you’re ready to act if you regulate anxiety and make your career requests concrete.
takeaways: Before the next call, run a 90‑second S-L-L-I routine: two physiological sighs (exhale-longer-than-inhale), label your feeling in 3 words, list one outcome you want, then initiate with a prewritten opener (e.g., “I’m exploring XAI roles—could you point me to two teams or a referral where my [skill] fits?”).

Convert support-seeking into a decisive ask: send a one-page micro-brief 24 hours prior (3 strengths, 2 portfolio links, 1 specific role/intro request, 2 questions), and open the meeting by referencing it to reduce avoidance and guide the conversation.
